members.member: Called before processing of entities begins.
Called after the processing of entities ends.
@return true if the system should be processed, false if not.
Override to implement code that gets executed when systems are initialized.
Called if the system has received a entity it is interested in, e.g. created or a component was added to it. @param e the entity that was added to this system.
Called if a entity was removed from this system, e.g. deleted or had one of it's components removed. @param e the entity that was removed from this system.
Process a entity this system is interested in. @param e the entity to process.
The entities to process with accumulated delta. @param entities read-only bag of entities.

Get the initial delay that the system was ordered to process entities after.
@return the originally set delay.

Check if the system is counting down towards processing.
@return true if it's counting down, false if it's not running.
Aborts running the system in the future and stops it. Call delayedRun() to start it again.
Process a entity this system is interested in. @param e the entity to process.
Time since last game loop. @return delta in milliseconds.

You must specify the delta for the game here.
@param delta time since last game loop.
Delete the provided entity from the world. @param e entity
Ensure all systems are notified of changes to this entity. @param e entity
Create and return a new or reused entity instance. @return entity
After adding all systems to the world, you must initialize them all.
Process a entity this system is interested in. @param e the entity to process.
@return how many entities are currently active.
@return how many entities have been created since start.
@return how many entities have been removed since start.
Process a entity this system is interested in. @param e the entity to process.
Process a entity this system is interested in. @param e the entity to process.
Process a entity this system is interested in. @param e the entity to process.
Removes the provided entity from the group it is assigned to, if any. @param e the entity.
@param e entity @return the name of the group that this entity belongs to, null if none.
Constructs an empty Bag with an initial capacity of 64.

Remove and return the last object in the bag.
@return the last object in the bag, null if empty.

Returns the number of elements in this bag.
@return the number of elements in this bag

Returns the number of elements the bag can hold without growing.
@return the number of elements the bag can hold without growing.

Returns true if this list contains no elements.
@return true if this list contains no elements

Adds the specified element to the end of this bag. if needed also increases the capacity of the bag.
@param o element to be added to this list
Removes all of the elements from this bag. The bag will be empty after this call returns.
Add all items into this bag. @param added
Get the unique ID of this entity. Because entity instances are reused internally use this to identify between different instances. @return the unique id of this entity.
Add a component to this entity. @param component to add to this entity
Removes the component from this entity. @param component to remove from this entity.
Faster removal of components from a entity. @param component to remove from this entity.
Checks if the entity has been deleted from somewhere. @return if it's active.

Get all components belonging to this entity. WARNING. Use only for debugging purposes, it is dead slow. WARNING. The returned bag is only valid until this method is called again, then it is overwritten. @return all components of this entity.

Refresh all changes to components for this entity. After adding or removing components, you must call this method. It will update all relevant systems. It is typical to call this after adding components to a newly created entity.
Delete this entity from the world.
Set the group of the entity. Same as World.setGroup(). @param group of the entity.
Assign a tag to this entity. Same as World.setTag(). @param tag of the entity.
